repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Essentially:

Expand the existing omp critical section to capture both the return, and the clean up of the initial value for __pyx_r.

Fix a few issues with returning memoryviewslices:
* have_gil is incorrect,
* they aren't reference counted if there's something existing there (which could happen in parallel code I think)

Keep as much arbitrary code outside the omp critical section (decref, any tracing handling).

This is already tested by parallel.pyx
test_parallel_with_gil_return, although it's a very intermittent failure.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6983,14 +6983,33 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
             return
 
         value = self.value
-        if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
-            code.put_xdecref(Naming.retval_cname, self.return_type)
+        if value:
+            value.generate_evaluation_code(code)
+
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            code.putln("{")
+            code.putln(f"{self.return_type.declaration_code(Naming.quick_temp_cname)};")
+
+        if self.in_parallel:
+            # If we have the GIL we can rely on it for locking (unless in freethreading).
+            # Where we use a critical section, we do our best to keep the contents as
+            # simple as possible.
+            code.putln_openmp(
+                "#pragma omp critical(__pyx_returning)",
+                additional_tests=(
+                    "CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON_FREETHREADING" if not self.in_nogil_context
+                    else None))
+        code.putln("{")
+
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            # decref must come after assignment because it can trigger
+            # arbitrary code execution (and thus release the GIL).
+            code.putln(f"{Naming.quick_temp_cname} = {Naming.retval_cname};")
             if value and value.is_none:
                 # Use specialised default handling for "return None".
                 value = None
 
         if value:
-            value.generate_evaluation_code(code)

@@ -6999,36 +7018,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)

@@ -6999,36 +7018,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
+                    have_gil=not self.in_nogil_context)
             else:
                 value.make_owned_reference(code)
                 code.putln("%s = %s;" % (
                     Naming.retval_cname,
                     value.result_as(self.return_type)))
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
-                if code.globalstate.directives['profile'] or code.globalstate.directives['linetrace']:

comment_data.body: is_pyobject -> needs_refcounting (so expanded to cover memoryviews)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6983,14 +6983,33 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
             return
 
         value = self.value
-        if self.return_type.is_pyobject:

comment_data.body: this was the wrong way round
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6999,36 +7018,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)

comment_data.body: This part was lost by moving the value evaluation up. It might not matter much, given that evaluating `None` doesn't do anything, but let's still keep the match of eval+postassign intact.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6983,14 +6983,33 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
             return
 
         value = self.value
-        if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
-            code.put_xdecref(Naming.retval_cname, self.return_type)
+        if value:
+            value.generate_evaluation_code(code)
+
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            code.putln("{")
+            code.putln(f"{self.return_type.declaration_code(Naming.quick_temp_cname)};")
+
+        if self.in_parallel:
+            # If we have the GIL we can rely on it for locking (unless in freethreading).
+            # Where we use a critical section, we do our best to keep the contents as
+            # simple as possible.
+            code.putln_openmp(
+                "#pragma omp critical(__pyx_returning)",
+                additional_tests=(
+                    "CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_CPYTHON_FREETHREADING" if not self.in_nogil_context
+                    else None))
+        code.putln("{")
+
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            # decref must come after assignment because it can trigger
+            # arbitrary code execution (and thus release the GIL).
+            code.putln(f"{Naming.quick_temp_cname} = {Naming.retval_cname};")
             if value and value.is_none:
                 # Use specialised default handling for "return None".
                 value = None

comment_data.body: Shouldn't this also use `funcstate.gil_owned` instead? (same above)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6999,36 +7018,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)

comment_data.body: I think they should be equivalent, but I'm made them all funcstate for consistency
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6999,36 +7018,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)

comment_data.body: I need to have a second look at this, but tracing feels like it might need some thread safety too. Although maybe that's a whole, much broader question.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6999,36 +7020,42 @@ def generate_execution_code(self, code):
                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
+                    have_gil=code.funcstate.gil_owned)
             else:
                 value.make_owned_reference(code)
                 code.putln("%s = %s;" % (
                     Naming.retval_cname,
                     value.result_as(self.return_type)))
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
-                if code.globalstate.directives['profile'] or code.globalstate.directives['linetrace']:
-                    code.put_trace_return(
-                        Naming.retval_cname,
-                        self.pos,
-                        return_type=self.return_type,
-                        nogil=not code.funcstate.gil_owned,
-                    )
-            value.free_temps(code)
         else:
             if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
                 code.put_init_to_py_none(Naming.retval_cname, self.return_type)
             elif self.return_type.is_returncode:
                 self.put_return(code, self.return_type.default_value)
 
+        code.putln("}")  # end of omp critical section
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            code.put_xdecref(
+                Naming.quick_temp_cname, self.return_type, have_gil=code.funcstate.gil_owned)
+            code.putln("}")  # end of quick_temp scope
+
+        if value:
+            value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
+            if (not self.return_type.is_memoryviewslice and
+                    code.globalstate.directives['profile'] or code.globalstate.directives['linetrace']):
+                code.put_trace_return(
+                    Naming.retval_cname,
+                    self.pos,
+                    return_type=self.return_type,
+                    nogil=not code.funcstate.gil_owned,
+                )

comment_data.body: For now I've decided to just disable this in parallel blocks. I think it's such a corner-case that it's barely worth the complication.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

                     lhs_pos=value.pos,
                     rhs=value,
                     code=code,
-                    have_gil=self.in_nogil_context)
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
+                    have_gil=code.funcstate.gil_owned)
             else:
                 value.make_owned_reference(code)
                 code.putln("%s = %s;" % (
                     Naming.retval_cname,
                     value.result_as(self.return_type)))
-                value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
-                if code.globalstate.directives['profile'] or code.globalstate.directives['linetrace']:
-                    code.put_trace_return(
-                        Naming.retval_cname,
-                        self.pos,
-                        return_type=self.return_type,
-                        nogil=not code.funcstate.gil_owned,
-                    )
-            value.free_temps(code)
         else:
             if self.return_type.is_pyobject:
                 code.put_init_to_py_none(Naming.retval_cname, self.return_type)
             elif self.return_type.is_returncode:
                 self.put_return(code, self.return_type.default_value)
 
+        code.putln("}")  # end of omp critical section
+        if self.return_type.needs_refcounting:
+            code.put_xdecref(
+                Naming.quick_temp_cname, self.return_type, have_gil=code.funcstate.gil_owned)
+            code.putln("}")  # end of quick_temp scope
+
+        if value:
+            value.generate_post_assignment_code(code)
+            if (not self.return_type.is_memoryviewslice and
+                    code.globalstate.directives['profile'] or code.globalstate.directives['linetrace']):

+                    self.pos,

commit.message:
Fix an intermittent race with return from parallel blocks

Essentially:

Expand the existing omp critical section to capture both the
return, and the clean up of the initial value for __pyx_r.

Fix a few issues with returning memoryviewslices:
* have_gil is incorrect,
* they aren't reference counted if there's something existing
  there (which could happen in parallel code I think)

Keep as much arbitrary code outside the omp critical section
(decref, any tracing handling).

This is already tested by sequential_parallel.pyx
test_parallel_with_gil_return, although it's a very intermittent
failure.
Just disable tracing in parallel blocks

title: Fix an intermittent race with return from parallel blocks
